0: A 32-year-old Iowa man died one day after getting punched in the face while talking to his fiancée outside their home. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The suspect drove up to Ryan Thompson and Lindsey Engquist on Monday, got out of the vehicle and then punched Thompson on the side of his face after saying he owed him money. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "It was a sucker punch," Engquist told WHO. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thompson was able to make it inside the home following the attack, but was slurring his words, according to the Des Moines Register. (via Facebook) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It turned out that the blow to the head ruptured a blood clot that no one knew existed, according to WHO. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The bleeding had become too much and he had to be put on a ventilator and he was pretty much kept alive by machines and his mother made the best decision and decided that he should just go and be at peace," Engquist told the station. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thompson passed away on Tuesday at a nearby hospital. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Fishing was one of Ryan Thompson's big passions. (via Facebook) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Cops have identified the suspect in the brutal attack, but an arrest has not been made. The suspect was in his 40s with black hair, a 10-year-old witness told cops, according to the Register. We think we've identified what the motivation may have been." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ryan Thompson with his ex-wife Stephanie Waddell and their two children. (Stephanie Waddell/via GoFundMe) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A funeral will be held on Saturday for Thompson, who leaves behind a son and a daughter. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He was in love with his children," ex-wife Ashley Waddell told the Register. "They hold him on a pedestal that no one can touch." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thompson loved fishing and was a Chicago Cubs and Bears fan, according to his obituary.
